title: For Sale:  Winchester Model 1917 WW1 Military execellent for investment
location: Central NH, New Hampshire, United States
postcontent:
Offered a very fine Winchester U.S. Model 1917 .30-06 rifle. S/N 326789, date of manufacture, June 1918. WW1 ended November 1918.
Winchester Model1917 Markings.
On the top of the barrel mouth; U.S. Model of 1917 Winchester, 326789. On the top of the barrel, just behind the front sight; is the Ordinance Bomb, with a “W” and the date of 6-18. This denotes the Mfg. as Winchester and the date it was Mfg. On the Bolt handle bottom [flat] is “W” and “SN” or NS depending how you look at it. On the top of the Bolt handle there is a small “Ordinance Bomb”. On the rear of firing pin assembly {Cap} is a small “W”. When the bolt handle is lifted there is a “W” or “B” stamp where the handle rests in the closed bolt position. The only part which is not Winchester is the Barrel Cap; the letter “R” is stamped, indicating the cap is likely Remington, although some say it denotes Remington as the stock Mfg.
Condition: The butt plate exhibits normal wear, dings from use on parade grounds. The butt plate has the cleaning rod reservoir, with the door. The stock has four professionally repair cartouches, 1.5mm X 1.0mm and 4.0mm X 1.0mm, on the left side, just to the rear of grip. The Bore is bright, no pitting with the bare eye and a bore light. There is a ding, 1/8” long, on the outside of the barrel near the crown. This ding has not damaged the crown, or the bore.
I believe this rifle falls between NRA GRADE.  Excellent and Fine
The following standards were set forth by the NRA for describing the condition of an antique firearm. The NRA officially calls these their "Condition Standards for Antique Firearms". This same grading system can be applied to modern firearms as well.
Excellent - all original parts; over 80% original finish; sharp lettering, numerals and design on metal and wood; unmarred wood; fine bore.

Fine - all original parts; 30% to 80% original finish; sharp lettering, numerals and design on metal and wood; minor marks in wood, good bore.
